title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
What are you top 3 Indian sound tracks from the 90s?

My top 3 in no particular order are 

1. Thiruda Thiruda (Tamil, ARR)

2. Anjali (Tamil, Ilayaraja)

3. 1942, A Love Story (RD's last finishing touches by Ranjit Barot and friends)


The first 2 are master classes in composing for movies. And it comes from the 2 who were right at the peak of their abilities.

1942 is an love story to all or RD's music. His death lent that soundtrack a pathos which, I believe, would not have been the case had he lived.

Hooked to Eric Clapton- Layla, Change the World, Wonderful Tonight, Lay down Sally etc.
Links - 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pKwQlm-wldA
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0dkzpNyKtf8
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KIzOxTCOc_0
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f9myqi7VL9s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kntzQiaFzOQ

Loving the amazing groovy laid back vibe of the band Khruangbin. 

This album is amazing 
https://open.spotify.com/album/2OPcQNLP8DQVumD8kBRAH3?si=GlG4SbW7Q-eXm6NV4xWKvg&utm_source=copy-link
